titles.title: Family Home-Care Act of 1992
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a refundable credit for individuals who provide long-term care for family members at home.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 1/26/1993--Introduced. Family Home-Care Act of 1992 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a refundable tax credit of $10,000 per qualified dependent in the case of a taxpayer who shares a home for more than half the taxable year with a parent, grandparent, dependent, or spouse who is determined by a physician to have an impairment rendering the individual physically or mentally incapable of caring for himself or herself in the long-term. Requires allocation of such credit among multiple eligible taxpayers.
